title: How to Get Crayon Out of Doll Hair

steps.headline: Cover the doll's hair in conditioner.
steps.description: Focus in particular on ensuring that the conditioner is covering the part of the doll's hair that has the crayon on it. Rub in a little but not so much that you mess up the hair. Note: This method should only be used on a doll that can be washed. If the doll surface might be harmed by water or conditioner, this method is not suitable.

steps.headline: Let the conditioner soak into the hair for fifteen to twenty minutes.
steps.description: Put the doll down on a towel in a cool, dry spot to let the conditioner work into the hair.

steps.headline: Wash the hair to remove the crayon.
steps.description:
Use lukewarm water and gently cleanse the hair, removing the crayon as follows:
Part the hair into sections for working on. Don't try to clean the whole area in one go, instead work methodically through each section covered in crayon. As you wash the hair, gently scrape your finger along the crayon stained area, to remove the crayon with your fingers and nails. If you need more conditioner, add more to your fingers and run it over the hair. Keep scraping in this way until all of the color lifts off. The crayon should come off easily with the conditioner.

steps.headline: Rinse the hair.
steps.description: Use lukewarm water to cleanse the hair of all remaining conditioner and any pieces of crayon left. Use a small measuring jug or a cup to stream the water over the hair gently.

steps.headline: Let the doll's hair dry overnight.
steps.description: Leave the doll on a towel in a warm, dry place to dry overnight. Do not place near a heater, to avoid harming the doll.

steps.headline: Use a gentle soap without coloring or scents.
Lather the soap with water.
steps.description: Rub the lather and soap over the affected area of the doll's hair.

steps.headline: Scrub the hair softly.
steps.description: Divide into strands and work carefully on each strand, gently rubbing off the crayon from the doll's hair.

steps.headline: Continue with each strand until all of the crayon has been removed.
Rinse the hair.
steps.description: Use lukewarm water to remove the lather and the crayon bits left on the hair.

steps.headline: Let the doll's hair dry overnight.
steps.description: Leave the doll on a towel in a warm, dry place to dry overnight. Do not place near a heater, to avoid harming the doll.

text:
Cleaning with Conditioner Cover the doll's hair in conditioner. Focus in particular on ensuring that the conditioner is covering the part of the doll's hair that has the crayon on it. Rub in a little but not so much that you mess up the hair. Note: This method should only be used on a doll that can be washed. If the doll surface might be harmed by water or conditioner, this method is not suitable. Let the conditioner soak into the hair for fifteen to twenty minutes. Put the doll down on a towel in a cool, dry spot to let the conditioner work into the hair. Wash the hair to remove the crayon. Use lukewarm water and gently cleanse the hair, removing the crayon as follows:
Part the hair into sections for working on. Don't try to clean the whole area in one go, instead work methodically through each section covered in crayon. As you wash the hair, gently scrape your finger along the crayon stained area, to remove the crayon with your fingers and nails. If you need more conditioner, add more to your fingers and run it over the hair. Keep scraping in this way until all of the color lifts off. The crayon should come off easily with the conditioner. Rinse the hair. Use lukewarm water to cleanse the hair of all remaining conditioner and any pieces of crayon left. Use a small measuring jug or a cup to stream the water over the hair gently. Let the doll's hair dry overnight. Leave the doll on a towel in a warm, dry place to dry overnight. Do not place near a heater, to avoid harming the doll. Cleaning with Soap Use a gentle soap without coloring or scents.  Lather the soap with water. Rub the lather and soap over the affected area of the doll's hair. Scrub the hair softly. Divide into strands and work carefully on each strand, gently rubbing off the crayon from the doll's hair. Continue with each strand until all of the crayon has been removed.  Rinse the hair. Use lukewarm water to remove the lather and the crayon bits left on the hair. Let the doll's hair dry overnight. Leave the doll on a towel in a warm, dry place to dry overnight. Do not place near a heater, to avoid harming the doll.
